ordination chirotonia containd inſtitution sanhedrim senat iſrael moses rome romulus divine generally way diſputing bias run upon word upon thing ſo place neceſſary give interpretation ſom word wherof pretend take ſtrong hold controverſys chief theſe bin ſpoken already chirotonia word properly ſignifys suffrage people wherever properly usd implys power wherfore tho senat decree suffrage well people yet decree senat authority senat never ſaid chirotonize ſeldom improperly word peculiar people thus much implyd went next word controverſy pſephiſma ſignifys decree chap 3 law always implying power always implys suffrage people ſpoken popular government tho pſephiſma decree athenian senat law year came suffrage chirotonia people yet law conſtitution solon wherby senat power originally derivd chirotonia people third word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſignifys conſtitute ordain political ſenſe ſame implys power authority man writes propoſes decree form government may ſaid 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 propoſe conſtitute whether confirmd chirotonia people nay halicarnassaeus word ſignifys barely call aſſemble senat 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 theſe word ſomtimes otherwiſe taken word language often usd improperly underſtood politically muſt neceſſity underſtood ſhewn ſo intangle diſorder government man ſhall either make head foot make little queſtion evince ſureſt way opening nature thing whence derive wherof ſpoken beſt author becauſe word tho thing ſignify much antient derive athens ſhall begin conſtitution ſhew proper uſe chirotonia athens bin ſhewn suidas ſpeaking rome refers election prytans prytans upon occaſion preſidents nomothetae wheras undoubted right practice people elect magiſtrats chirotonia 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 nevertheleſs phil 1ſhewn pollux bin peculiar office theſmothetae 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 chirotonize magiſtrats proedri preſidents people legiſlative capacity ſo theſmothetae upon occaſion election thus chirotonia l 8 c 8of proedri theſmothetae ſignifys nothing elſe chirotonia people enacted law elected civil eccleſiaſtical magiſtrats prieſts rex sacrificus orgeones except ſom lot ordination obſervd aristotle equally popular whether ignorantly wilfully unregarded bin ſeen hereafter cauſe great abſurdity ſees put chirotonia soverain power athens upon proedri theſmothetae make ſuch thing government wiſe underſtood book ii people paſt chirotonia calld pſephiſma act law becauſe nomothetae always two law put together vote ſay old one offerd room old law ſaid 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 pronounce negative new 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 pronounce
